title: The Lair
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Most adventurers find the Lair of Beasts to be an exciting change of climate. And indeed, there is something to be said about getting gored, mauled and eaten rather than sliced, burnt or stabbed.The Lair contains the entrances to one of the Swamp or the Shoals, one of the Snake Pit or the Spider Nest, and to the Pits of Slime.The entrance to this branch can be found between levels 8 and 11 of the Dungeon.This branch is 5 levels deep. |

[![Lair entry.png](/images/b/b8/Lair_entry.png)](/File:Lair_entry.png) **The Lair of Beasts** (commonly known as **the Lair**) is a [branch](/Branch "Branch") filled with natural beasts. While the Lair itself doesn't have a [Rune of Zot](/Rune_of_Zot "Rune of Zot"), it features entrances to three themed branches that do. There is one [poison](/Poison "Poison")-themed branch ([the Snake Pit](/The_Snake_Pit "The Snake Pit") or [the Spider's Nest](/The_Spider%27s_Nest "The Spider's Nest")), one [water](/Water "Water")-themed branch ([the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp") or [the Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals")), and the [acid](/Acid "Acid")-themed [Slime Pits](/Slime_Pits "Slime Pits").

The staircase to the Lair is located on D:8-11, and is often surrounded by [plants](/Plant "Plant"), [fungi](/Fungi "Fungi"), or occasionally an [oklob plant](/Oklob_plant "Oklob plant"). There may also be multiple denizens of the Lair scattered around the entrance, like [yaks](/Yak "Yak"), [basilisks](/Basilisk "Basilisk"), or a [komodo dragon](/Komodo_dragon "Komodo dragon").

## Contents

- [1 Layout](#Layout)
  - [1.1 Lair:5](#Lair:5)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Monsters](#Monsters)

  - [3.1 Common Monsters](#Common_Monsters)
  - [3.2 Uniques](#Uniques)

- [4 Lair:5 vaults](#Lair:5_vaults)

  - [4.1 Large lair end vaults](#Large_lair_end_vaults)
  - [4.2 Small lair end vaults](#Small_lair_end_vaults)

- [5 History](#History)

## Layout

The Lair is 5 levels deep. Floor layouts vary significantly, including wide open chambers with almost no cover, series of interconnected small chambers with narrow hallways between them, and open areas dotted with either small forests or ponds. The topography of the Lair is quite irregular; while narrow passages exist, often there will be few true one-tile-wide tunnels, ensuring the various pack animals have ways to swarm passersby. In any case, there will often be pools of [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water"), [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water"), and occasionally [lava](/Lava "Lava") placed throughout.

While there are very few [altars](/Altar "Altar") found in the Lair, those wishing to worship [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva") can often (66%) find an altar immediately outside of the Slime Pits on Lair:4 or 5.

### Lair:5

The bottom floor of the Lair is generally fairly open, but will always contain one or two end [vaults](/Vault "Vault") that contain both an assortment of stronger monsters and a selection of treasure. These vaults may range from a secluded set of caves to a forest containing a temple or perhaps several bands of spriggans. See the [#Lair:5 vaults](#Lair:5_vaults) section below for what to expect from the different options.

Like other branch ends, Lair:5 is usually more dangerous than the preceding floors, so explore it carefully.

## Strategy

This branch is generally worth doing, at least for the XP and items. The Lair, when compared to late [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") (D:13+) and [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"), is usually easier and/or safer to do. The other branches are more likely to have nasty [out-of-depth](/Out-of-depth "Out-of-depth") monsters: Dungeon can have [banishing](/Banish "Banish") [wizards](/Wizard "Wizard"), even [storm dragons](/Storm_dragon "Storm dragon") if you're unlucky. Orc can host brutish [ettins](/Ettin "Ettin") and [stone giants](/Stone_giant "Stone giant").

Lair is filled with animals. A good chunk of enemies ([cane toads](/Cane_toad "Cane toad"), [blink frogs](/Blink_frog "Blink frog"), [black mambas](/Black_mamba "Black mamba")) are fast - and each one is surprisingly deadly. [Hydras](/Hydra "Hydra") can be obscenely strong melee threats, depending on the number of heads. [Elephants](/Elephant "Elephant") can shove you off the [stairs](/Stairs "Stairs"), [lindwurms](/Lindwurm "Lindwurm") and [rime drakes](/Rime_drake "Rime drake") can fire elemental ranged attacks, and [death yaks](/Death_yak "Death yak") are tough pack enemies with high [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower").

[Poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") is helpful, due to the amount of venomous creatures, but not necessary. Most other resistances aren't necessary, though having swappable resistances (rF+ for lindwurms, rC+ for rime drakes, rCorr for [oklob plants](/Oklob_plant "Oklob plant")...) won't hurt.

The Lair's sub-branches are significantly more difficult than Lair itself. At the *very* least, you'll want to clear Lair:1-5 before entering any of the branches. Many players will additionally clear Dungeon and Orc before attempting any of the branches. Also, note that the [Slime Pits](/Slime_Pits "Slime Pits") is much more difficult than the other possible branches, often saved for much later in the game.

## Monsters

### Common Monsters

| h [![Polar bear.png](/images/1/1a/Polar_bear.png)](/File:Polar_bear.png) **[Polar bear](/Polar_bear "Polar bear")**             | h [![Black bear.png](/images/1/1c/Black_bear.png)](/File:Black_bear.png) **[Black bear](/Black_bear "Black bear")**             | S [![Water moccasin.png](/images/f/fc/Water_moccasin.png)](/File:Water_moccasin.png) **[Water moccasin](/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")** | S [![Black mamba.png](/images/2/26/Black_mamba.png)](/File:Black_mamba.png) **[Black mamba](/Black_mamba "Black mamba")** | B [![Boulder beetle.png](/images/2/2b/Boulder_beetle.png)](/File:Boulder_beetle.png) **[Boulder beetle](/Boulder_beetle "Boulder beetle")** |
| w [![Torpor snail.png](/images/a/a5/Torpor_snail.png)](/File:Torpor_snail.png) **[Torpor snail](/Torpor_snail "Torpor snail")** | D [![Hydra.png](/images/9/9d/Hydra.png)](/File:Hydra.png) **[Hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")**                                           | F [![Cane toad.png](/images/b/bf/Cane_toad.png)](/File:Cane_toad.png) **[Cane toad](/Cane_toad "Cane toad")**                               | F [![Blink frog.png](/images/2/24/Blink_frog.png)](/File:Blink_frog.png) **[Blink frog](/Blink_frog "Blink frog")**       | k [![Rime drake.png](/images/c/cb/Rime_drake.png)](/File:Rime_drake.png) **[Rime drake](/Rime_drake "Rime drake")**                         |
| D [![Steam dragon.png](/images/9/94/Steam_dragon.png)](/File:Steam_dragon.png) **[Steam dragon](/Steam_dragon "Steam dragon")** | S [![Electric eel.png](/images/f/f9/Electric_eel.png)](/File:Electric_eel.png) **[Electric eel](/Electric_eel "Electric eel")** | k [![Lindwurm.png](/images/8/85/Lindwurm.png)](/File:Lindwurm.png) **[Lindwurm](/Lindwurm "Lindwurm")**                                     | l [![Skyshark.png](/images/1/14/Skyshark.png)](/File:Skyshark.png) **[Skyshark](/Skyshark "Skyshark")**                   |                                                                                                                                             |

Monsters native to a lair branch may reside at its entrance; [merfolk](/List_of_merfolk "List of merfolk") for the [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals"), [redbacks](/Redback "Redback") for the [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest"), etc.  
There are also many pregenerated [vaults](/Vault "Vault") with monsters inside (ex. a [Hive](/Hive "Hive") filled with [killer bees](/Killer_bee "Killer bee") and a [queen bee](/Queen_bee "Queen bee")).

### Uniques

|                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                             |                                                                                                         |                                                                                                               |

| F [![Prince Ribbit.png](/images/8/87/Prince_Ribbit.png)](/File:Prince_Ribbit.png) **[Prince Ribbit](/Prince_Ribbit "Prince Ribbit")** | @ [![Rupert.png](/images/f/fc/Rupert.png)](/File:Rupert.png) **[Rupert](/Rupert "Rupert")** | T [![Snorg.png](/images/e/e8/Snorg.png)](/File:Snorg.png) **[Snorg](/Snorg "Snorg")**                   | K [![Sonja.png](/images/c/ce/Sonja.png)](/File:Sonja.png) **[Sonja](/Sonja "Sonja")**                         |
| o [![Urug.png](/images/b/b6/Urug.png)](/File:Urug.png) **[Urug](/Urug "Urug")**                                                       |                                                                                             |                                                                                                         |                                                                                                               |

## Lair:5 vaults

The last level of the Lair is more difficult than the previous levels. It always includes at least one of these vaults -- either one large vault, or two small vaults.

### Large lair end vaults

- **minmay\_lair\_end\_enchanted\_forest**: A forest populated by various wild beasts as well as several [spriggans](/List_of_spriggans "List of spriggans"), some [spriggan riders](/Spriggan_rider "Spriggan rider"), and a few [boggarts](/Boggart "Boggart").
- **due\_jungle\_book**: A temple in the middle of a jungle. This vault contains a spectral [anaconda](/Anaconda "Anaconda") with necromancer and [dire elephant](/Dire_elephant "Dire elephant") buddies.
- **evil\_forest**: A forest with a temple guarded by a [wizard](/Wizard_\(monster\) "Wizard (monster)"), who can occasionally have very dangerous spells like [Paralyze](/Paralyze "Paralyze"), [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear"), or [Banishment](/Banishment "Banishment"). Past the wizard is a room containing a gateway to the [Vestibule of Hell](/Vestibule_of_Hell "Vestibule of Hell") guarded by several [demons](/Demon "Demon"). Entering the gate at this point is a fast way to die -- at least wait until you're ready for the [Depths](/Depths "Depths").
- **minmay\_lair\_end\_frog\_pond**: A large pond containing many frogs, [vampire mosquitoes](/Vampire_mosquito "Vampire mosquito"), some [electric eels](/Electric_eel "Electric eel"), and a few [tyrant leeches](/Tyrant_leech "Tyrant leech").
- **evilmike\_catoblepas\_cave**: A series of caves full of [yaks](/Yak "Yak"), [death yaks](/Death_yak "Death yak"), and [catoblepae](/Catoblepae "Catoblepae") signified by the presence of petrified plants and statues around the entrance.
- **grunt\_lair\_end\_beastmaster**: A [deep troll shaman](/Deep_troll_shaman "Deep troll shaman") has tamed some beasts including a [catoblepas](/Catoblepas "Catoblepas"), a pack of [death yaks](/Death_yak "Death yak"), and one the following: [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra"), [lindwurm](/Lindwurm "Lindwurm") or [dire elephant](/Dire_elephant "Dire elephant").
- **gammafunk\_lair\_ancient\_temple**: An open stone structure that has been flooded. Contains an assortment of aquatic monsters, some mythological beasts, and a [merfolk avatar](/Merfolk_avatar "Merfolk avatar").
- **cheibrodos\_lair\_end\_hotspot**: A miniature volcano full of fiery monsters. The central chamber contains a [fire dragon](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon") and its hoard.

### Small lair end vaults

- **wormcave**: A cave full of [tyrant leeches](/Tyrant_leech "Tyrant leech"), [torpor snails](/Torpor_snail "Torpor snail"), [hornets](/Hornet "Hornet"), and [lindwurms](/Lindwurm "Lindwurm"). There's also a single [fire](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon") or [ice dragon](/Ice_dragon "Ice dragon") guarding a room full of piles of gold, but that fight is optional (don't open the [runed door](/Runed_door "Runed door") if you aren't ready to face it).
- **hangedman\_lair\_caniforms\_friends**: An assortment of [hound](/List_of_canines "List of canines")- and [bear](/List_of_bears "List of bears")-type monsters. Expect fire damage from [hell hounds](/Hell_hound "Hell hound"), electricity damage from [raiju](/Raiju "Raiju"), and heavy physical damage from angry [polar bears](/Polar_bear "Polar bear").
- **guppyfry\_lair\_end\_dragon**: A grove of trees surrounded by a small lake. Full of [lizards](/List_of_reptiles_and_amphibians "List of reptiles and amphibians") and [lesser dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons"), with one proper dragon in the center.
- **hangedman\_lair\_in\_review** (S): A series of ruined rooms. This vault is a review of the Lair's monster set: you'll be seeing a variety of different monsters found in the Lair, plus a few more dangerous creatures like [manticores](/Manticore "Manticore").
- **hangedman\_lair\_tendril\_chambers**: A circular area cut into several wedge-shaped sections full of fast, often venomous monsters ([wyverns](/Wyvern "Wyvern"), [black mambas](/Black_mamba "Black mamba"), [cane toads](/Cane_toad "Cane toad"), etc.). One or two of the wedges lead to a central chamber that in turn leads to a stone room that contains the treasure and a more dangerous assortment of monsters like [wolf spiders](/Wolf_spider "Wolf spider"), [redbacks](/Redback "Redback"), and a [guardian serpent](/Guardian_serpent "Guardian serpent").

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), the Lair had 6 levels; Slime spawned from Lair:5-6, and the other branches from Lair:2-4. [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva")'s altar near the entrance to Slime was about 50% (based on [vault](/Vault "Vault") choice) instead of 66%.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the Lair had 8 levels.
- [Fire drakes](/Fire_drake "Fire drake") were replaced by [rime drakes](/Rime_drake "Rime drake") in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), [trapdoor spiders](/Trapdoor_spider "Trapdoor spider"), [brain worms](/Brain_worm "Brain worm") were removed.
- [Ravens](/Raven "Raven"), [giant mites](/Giant_mite "Giant mite"), [boring beetles](/Boring_beetle "Boring beetle") and [goliath beetles](/Goliath_beetle "Goliath beetle") were removed in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the Lair's entrance was located on D:8-13.
- In [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), the dragon-themed and deep troll shaman ending vaults on the eighth floor were added.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), a scroll of magic mapping would reveal the secret rooms of the temple on Lair:8.

| [Dungeon branches](/Dungeon_branches "Dungeon branches")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

html:
The Lair

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Most adventurers find the Lair of Beasts to be an exciting change of climate. And indeed, there is something to be said about getting gored, mauled and eaten rather than sliced, burnt or stabbed.

The Lair contains the entrances to one of the Swamp or the Shoals, one of the Snake Pit or the Spider Nest, and to the Pits of Slime.

The entrance to this branch can be found between levels 8 and 11 of the Dungeon.

This branch is 5 levels deep.

The Lair of Beasts (commonly known as the Lair) is a branch filled with natural beasts. While the Lair itself doesn't have a Rune of Zot, it features entrances to three themed branches that do. There is one poison-themed branch (the Snake Pit or the Spider's Nest), one water-themed branch (the Swamp or the Shoals), and the acid-themed Slime Pits.

The staircase to the Lair is located on D:8-11, and is often surrounded by plants, fungi, or occasionally an oklob plant. There may also be multiple denizens of the Lair scattered around the entrance, like yaks, basilisks, or a komodo dragon.

Contents

  • 1 Layout
    • 1.1 Lair:5
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Monsters
    • 3.1 Common Monsters
    • 3.2 Uniques
  • 4 Lair:5 vaults
    • 4.1 Large lair end vaults
    • 4.2 Small lair end vaults
  • 5 History

Layout

The Lair is 5 levels deep. Floor layouts vary significantly, including wide open chambers with almost no cover, series of interconnected small chambers with narrow hallways between them, and open areas dotted with either small forests or ponds. The topography of the Lair is quite irregular; while narrow passages exist, often there will be few true one-tile-wide tunnels, ensuring the various pack animals have ways to swarm passersby. In any case, there will often be pools of shallow water, deep water, and occasionally lava placed throughout.

While there are very few altars found in the Lair, those wishing to worship Jiyva can often (66%) find an altar immediately outside of the Slime Pits on Lair:4 or 5.

Lair:5

The bottom floor of the Lair is generally fairly open, but will always contain one or two end vaults that contain both an assortment of stronger monsters and a selection of treasure. These vaults may range from a secluded set of caves to a forest containing a temple or perhaps several bands of spriggans. See the #Lair:5 vaults section below for what to expect from the different options.

Like other branch ends, Lair:5 is usually more dangerous than the preceding floors, so explore it carefully.

Strategy

This branch is generally worth doing, at least for the XP and items. The Lair, when compared to late Dungeon (D:13+) and Orcish Mines, is usually easier and/or safer to do. The other branches are more likely to have nasty out-of-depth monsters: Dungeon can have banishing wizards, even storm dragons if you're unlucky. Orc can host brutish ettins and stone giants.

Lair is filled with animals. A good chunk of enemies (cane toads, blink frogs, black mambas) are fast - and each one is surprisingly deadly. Hydras can be obscenely strong melee threats, depending on the number of heads. Elephants can shove you off the stairs, lindwurms and rime drakes can fire elemental ranged attacks, and death yaks are tough pack enemies with high willpower.

Poison resistance is helpful, due to the amount of venomous creatures, but not necessary. Most other resistances aren't necessary, though having swappable resistances (rF+ for lindwurms, rC+ for rime drakes, rCorr for oklob plants...) won't hurt.

The Lair's sub-branches are significantly more difficult than Lair itself. At the very least, you'll want to clear Lair:1-5 before entering any of the branches. Many players will additionally clear Dungeon and Orc before attempting any of the branches. Also, note that the Slime Pits is much more difficult than the other possible branches, often saved for much later in the game.

Monsters

Common Monsters

Y Yak Y Death yak Y Dream sheep Y Elephant Y Catoblepas
h Polar bear h Black bear S Water moccasin S Black mamba B Boulder beetle
w Torpor snail D Hydra F Cane toad F Blink frog k Rime drake
D Steam dragon S Electric eel k Lindwurm l Skyshark

Monsters native to a lair branch may reside at its entrance; merfolk for the Shoals, redbacks for the Spider's Nest, etc.
There are also many pregenerated vaults with monsters inside (ex. a Hive filled with killer bees and a queen bee).

Lair:5 vaults

The last level of the Lair is more difficult than the previous levels. It always includes at least one of these vaults -- either one large vault, or two small vaults.

Large lair end vaults

  • minmay_lair_end_enchanted_forest: A forest populated by various wild beasts as well as several spriggans, some spriggan riders, and a few boggarts.
  • due_jungle_book: A temple in the middle of a jungle. This vault contains a spectral anaconda with necromancer and dire elephant buddies.
  • evil_forest: A forest with a temple guarded by a wizard, who can occasionally have very dangerous spells like Paralyze, Lehudib's Crystal Spear, or Banishment. Past the wizard is a room containing a gateway to the Vestibule of Hell guarded by several demons. Entering the gate at this point is a fast way to die -- at least wait until you're ready for the Depths.
  • minmay_lair_end_frog_pond: A large pond containing many frogs, vampire mosquitoes, some electric eels, and a few tyrant leeches.
  • evilmike_catoblepas_cave: A series of caves full of yaks, death yaks, and catoblepae signified by the presence of petrified plants and statues around the entrance.
  • grunt_lair_end_beastmaster: A deep troll shaman has tamed some beasts including a catoblepas, a pack of death yaks, and one the following: hydra, lindwurm or dire elephant.
  • gammafunk_lair_ancient_temple: An open stone structure that has been flooded. Contains an assortment of aquatic monsters, some mythological beasts, and a merfolk avatar.
  • cheibrodos_lair_end_hotspot: A miniature volcano full of fiery monsters. The central chamber contains a fire dragon and its hoard.

Small lair end vaults

  • wormcave: A cave full of tyrant leeches, torpor snails, hornets, and lindwurms. There's also a single fire or ice dragon guarding a room full of piles of gold, but that fight is optional (don't open the runed door if you aren't ready to face it).
  • hangedman_lair_caniforms_friends: An assortment of hound- and bear-type monsters. Expect fire damage from hell hounds, electricity damage from raiju, and heavy physical damage from angry polar bears.
  • guppyfry_lair_end_dragon: A grove of trees surrounded by a small lake. Full of lizards and lesser dragons, with one proper dragon in the center.
  • hangedman_lair_in_review (S): A series of ruined rooms. This vault is a review of the Lair's monster set: you'll be seeing a variety of different monsters found in the Lair, plus a few more dangerous creatures like manticores.
  • hangedman_lair_tendril_chambers: A circular area cut into several wedge-shaped sections full of fast, often venomous monsters (wyverns, black mambas, cane toads, etc.). One or two of the wedges lead to a central chamber that in turn leads to a stone room that contains the treasure and a more dangerous assortment of monsters like wolf spiders, redbacks, and a guardian serpent.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, the Lair had 6 levels; Slime spawned from Lair:5-6, and the other branches from Lair:2-4. Jiyva's altar near the entrance to Slime was about 50% (based on vault choice) instead of 66%.
  • Prior to 0.19, the Lair had 8 levels.
  • Fire drakes were replaced by rime drakes in 0.18, trapdoor spiders, brain worms were removed.
  • Ravens, giant mites, boring beetles and goliath beetles were removed in 0.17.
  • Prior to 0.14, the Lair's entrance was located on D:8-13.
  • In 0.12, the dragon-themed and deep troll shaman ending vaults on the eighth floor were added.
  • Prior to 0.9, a scroll of magic mapping would reveal the secret rooms of the temple on Lair:8.
